airbyte-connection.name: Airbyte Connection
airbyte-connection.description: A block representing an existing Airbyte connection.
airbyte-connection.code_example:
Load an existing `AirbyteConnection` block:
```python
from prefect_airbyte import AirbyteConnection

airbyte_connection = AirbyteConnection.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

Run an Airbyte connection sync as a flow:
```python
from prefect import flow
from prefect_airbyte import AirbyteConnection
from prefect_airbyte.flows import run_connection_sync # this is a flow

airbyte_connection = AirbyteConnection.load("BLOCK_NAME")

@flow
def airbyte_orchestrator():
    run_connection_sync(airbyte_connection) # now it's a subflow
```

fields.title: AirbyteConnection
fields.description: A block representing an existing Airbyte connection.

airbyte_server.title: Airbyte Server
airbyte_server.description: AirbyteServer block representing the Airbyte instance where the Airbyte connection is defined.

connection_id.title: Connection Id
connection_id.description: UUID of the Airbyte Connection to trigger.

poll_interval_s.title: Poll Interval S
poll_interval_s.description: Time in seconds between status checks of the Airbyte sync job.

status_updates.title: Status Updates
status_updates.description: Whether to log job status on each poll of the Airbyte sync job.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for requests made by httpx.AsyncClient.

AirbyteServer.title: AirbyteServer
AirbyteServer.description: A block representing an Airbyte server for generating `AirbyteClient` instances.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to authenticate with Airbyte API.

password.title: Password
password.description: Password to authenticate with Airbyte API.

use_ssl.title: Use SSL
use_ssl.description: Whether to use SSL when connecting to Airbyte server.

```python
from prefect_airbyte.server import AirbyteServer

```
